summary:
💻 comms advisor with strong organizational skills

💚 online & offline community
💪  innovative approaches
💜 #OpenSource
👍 organizational skills
❤️ 👧👧
🏠 Rotterdam-West

I enjoy:
- getting stuff done today while linking to a strategic long-term vision
- involving diverse people and their varied skills & insights to achieve better results in a wide range of activities
- facilitating group change and utilizing my network
- integrating innovative communication strategies to support inclusiveness and support a greener world
- supporting open source, open data and open access to level the playing field and provide essential tools and information to citizens globally

projects.title: Vrijeschool Rotterdam-West i.o.
projects.description: Together with the other steering group members, including two other volunteering parents and staff from the Samenwerkende Vrijescholen Zuid-Holland (SVZH), we steered the establishment of a new Waldorf / Steiner school in Rotterdam-West. With the passion and work of a large group of enthusiastic volunteers we succeeded, and the school became operational as per August 2015.

projects.title: International Women's Day / World Water Day conference on Women and Water Make Sustainable Food Security Happen.
projects.description: UNESCO-IHE's International Women's Day conference is an annually recurring event, organized to strengthen the inclusion of women in the water sector, and create gender awareness among students, alumni and other (face-to-face and online) attendees.  In 2015, we chose to combine International Women's Day with World Water Day, to show the relevance of the linkages between the two. The first edition of UNESCO-IHE's International Women's Day conference was in 2014, with a  conference on 'Tapping into the unlocked potential of women in emergencies'.

projects.title: UNESCO-IHE's World Water Day celebrations
projects.description:
World Water Day is held annually on 22 March as a means of focusing attention on the importance of freshwater and advocating for the sustainable management of freshwater resources. UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education celebrates International World Water Day every year, providing inputs into external events, as well as organizing an internal event in Delft, The Netherlands. 

The 2014 event, taking place on 21 March, featured the role of water in the Development Goals in its World Water Day activities. It included a keynote on 'Sustainability without water?' by Andras Szollosi-Nagy, Rector, and the Valedictory Address 'Achieving the SDGs: public good with private money? The contribution of economics to water and sanitation problems' by Meine Pieter van Dijk, Professor of Water Services Management. UNESCO-IHE students also "Walked on Water" during a flash-mob in Delft's historical city centre.

projects.title: IHE Delft's first-ever Online Graduation Ceremony 2020
projects.description: On 23 April 2020, IHE Delft held the online graduation of the ceremony academic period 2018 - 2020. For the first time ever, the ceremony was held online due to distancing measures taken to keep our students and staff safe. 141 of our hard-working students from over 54 different countries celebrated their accomplishments leading up to receiving their diplomas.

profile_positions.description: I give online communication advice for educational & research institutes. I also give individual and group trainings on profiling oneself or one's institute on online (social media) channels.
profile_positions.title: Online communication advisor / Adviseur online communicatie

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
As a corporate communications advisor, I am part of the team that develops and implements a multichannel communication and marketing strategy. I constantly seek to improve our communication tools to simplify the production of engaging messages and use them across our channels.

I advise management and (academic) colleagues on communication strategies and best practices, empowering them with knowledge of and access to the channels they need to better share their activities. Enabling colleagues to improve their communication turns them into ambassadors of IHE Delft, amplifying the overarching communication strategy.

Strategically planning and overseeing communications on IHE Delft's social media channels falls under my responsibility. We use these channels to engage with and inform our broad audience of the activities that IHE Delft and its staff, PhD fellows, students, alumni, and partners are undertaking. I have grown these channels from the onset to where they are today.

I develop and create online media content - increasingly including visual content - together with specialized agencies and colleagues. Visual content includes corporate videos, webinars, live streams of online events, photo stories & topical photo series, and short (marketing) videos. 

I organize corporate events, including those held online. During the Coronavirus outbreak, I was instrumental in organizing an online graduation for our MSc students. I share and advise on best practices to help my colleagues make the most of their own specialized events and visitors' programmes. 

I led the development of our corporate intranets and help to maintain informative and consistent internal messaging. This helps colleagues, PhD candidates, and students find the information they need to get their work done, and engages them in what happens at the Institute outside their specialty.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Communications Advisor

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
As corporate communications advisor, I am part of the team that develops and implements a multi-channel communication strategy. I constantly seek to improve our communication tools to make the production of news easier, and the end results more engaging. 

I advise management and (academic) employees on communication strategies and best practices, empowering them with knowledge of and access to the channels they need to better share the outputs of their activities. This, in turn, amplifies the overarching strategy of the Institute, showing a wide range of our activities.

Strategically planning and overseeing communications on UNESCO-IHE's social media channels falls under my responsibility, using these channels to engage with and inform our very broad audience. 

I lead the development of the corporate intranet and help to maintain consistent and informative internal messaging, engaging employees to become advocates of the Institute and its strategy and allowing them to find the information they need to get their work done.

Corporate content that I monitor builds on UNESCO-IHE's image and maintains its corporate identity and positioning. Corporate content that I produce includes the Institutional film and annual report but also multimedia projects and all sorts of (web / intranet) articles. 

I organize several events at the Institute, such as the annually recurring Womens' Day and Water Sector Market. I am currently working on several events during the Institute's 60th anniversary in 2017. I share tools and best practices to help my colleagues manage their events and tailor their visitors' programmes successfully.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Communications Advisor (@ UNESCO-IHE)

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
As the Corporate Communications Officer, I am part of UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education's Communication Office.

I am in charge of UNESCO-IHE’s corporate collateral and internal communication, leading the production of i.e. the Annual Report and monthly internal interUPDATE newsletter. I also manage the Institute's corporate social media platforms, communicating UNESCO-IHE's impact on the world - as well as corporate partnerships and interests - to a constantly increasing audience. 

I organize corporate events including the annually recurring International Women's Day conference, internal World Water Day celebrations, the Water Sector Market and the opening of the Institute's historical OD 95 building during the International Heritage Days.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Communications Officer

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
As the Public Relations Officer, I was part of UNESCO-IHE's Marketing and Communications team. I was often the first contact for those interested in UNESCO-IHE, and answer or redirect a wide range of queries from outside (and within) the Institute. 

I played a central role in maintaining UNESCO-IHE's corporate presence on social media outlets, and often advised on the use of social media and online tools.

I was in charge of the development of the Institute's marketing material. Besides that, I produced UNESCO-IHE's Annual Report, regularly published the internal 'Yellow Pages' newsletter and supported the development of other corporate and PR collateral.

I arranged programmes for high-level and group visits to the Institute. I also handled UNESCO-IHE's corporate presence at fairs, conferences and other PR events. I was the Lady Speaker at the MSc graduation ceremony, and whenever else it was required.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Officer

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: As UNESCO-IHE's Beadle, I dealt with the logistical coordination of Academic Ceremonies, including PhD promotions, Inaugural Addresses, and Professor Farewells. I also acted as the Beadle during these ceremonies.
profile_positions.title: Beadle

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: The Personnel Council (PC; in Dutch: ondernemingsraad) is elected by staff members, and conducts staff consultations with the employer on their behalf. The PC must agree with new personnel regulations, and the PC must advise on major changes in the organisation from a staff perspective. I held both the Deputy Chair and Secretary positions for one term.
profile_positions.title: Personnel Council, Deputy Chair & Secretary position

profile_positions.description:
Vrijeschool Rotterdam-West, the new Waldorf / Steiner school in Rotterdam-West, will start in August 2015. This is something that I, together with the other board members as well as many enthusiastic volunteers, made happen. 

De Vrijeschool Rotterdam-West start in augustus 2015. Ik heb hier, samen met de andere stuurgroepleden en veel enthousiaste vrijwilligers, voor gezorgd.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Steering Committee / Lid van de Stuurgroep

volunteer_experiences.description: Meedenken over de herijking van de jaarfeesten, adviseren over online communicatie, ontwikkelen online Lichtfeest tijdens Corona

volunteer_experiences.role: Member Steering Committee / Lid van de Stuurgroep
volunteer_experiences.description:
Together with the other steering group members, decide on the establishment of a new Waldorf / Steiner school in Rotterdam-West. The school will be operational as per August 2015.

Samen met de andere stuurgroepleden, de richting bepalen van de op te richten vrijeschool in Rotterdam-West. De Vrijeschool Rotterdam-West start in augustus 2015.

volunteer_experiences.role: Lid werkgroep communicatie & publiciteit / Member Communication & Publicity working group
volunteer_experiences.description:
Communication and PR work for a new Waldorf / Steiner school to be established in Rotterdam-West. I do this together with the other members of the Communication & PR working group. Vrijeschool Rotterdam-West will start in August 2015.

Allerlei communicatie- & publiciteitswerkzaamheden voor een nieuw op te richten vrijeschool in Rotterdam-West. Dit doe ik samen met de andere leden van de werkgroep Communicatie/Publiciteit. De Vrijeschool Rotterdam-West start in augustus 2015.
